intro: Corysanthes heberlei, commonly known as the Christmas star or star-shaped hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is characterized by its striking, star-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with woody stems and glossy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Corysanthes heberlei is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
